page.title: 12The New Road
page.content: There are still many,narrow,single track roads,with passing places in this area.However a new road is being built at the moment which will greatly improve the communication with the west of Scotland.It is being built from Maryburgh to Moy Bridge and when it is finished this will be the main route to Ullapool,Gairloch and other west coast villages.The road is being built by Shanks,MacEwen,Engineers of Perth.The completion date is set for November,nineteen eighty five.This new road will link up with another new stretch of road which was recently built at Garve,and when complete will greatly reduce the travelling time to the west.This route is used greatly by fish lorries bringing the catches of white fish from the west coast to the markets and factories in the eastern and central parts of the country.
